  • Method Details

    • createAButton

      public static JButton createAButton(String text, int width, int height, int xPos, int yPos, SpringLayout layout, JFrame frame, ActionListener listener)
      This method takes the parameters given within the method call to generate a JButton component and locate it using a SpringLayout. The button will be given text to display, a size location and actionlistener before being returned to the caller in working fashion.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be printed on the label
      width - the width in pixels of the button.
      height - height the height in pixels of the button.
      xPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the X-axis of the form.
      yPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the Y-axis of the form.
      layout - layout the SpringLayout component used for positioning the button.
      frame - the JFrame the button is being added to.
      listener - the action listener of the window.
      Returns:
      the completed button is returned to the caller once configured.

    • createATable

      public static JTable createATable(int xPos, int yPos, SpringLayout layout, JFrame frame, int width, int height, MyTableModel questions)

    • createATextField

      public static JTextField createATextField(int xPos, int yPos, SpringLayout layout, JFrame frame, int width, int height)
      This method takes the parameters given within the method call to generate a JTextField component and locate it using a SpringLayout. The text field will be given a size and location, before being returned to the caller in working fashion.
      Parameters:
      xPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the X-axis of the form
      yPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the Y-axis of the form
      layout - the SpringLayout component used for positioning the text field
      frame - the JFrame the text field is being added to.
      width - the width in pixels of the text field.
      height - the height in pixels of the text field.
      Returns:
      the completed text field is returned to the caller once configured.

    • createATextArea

      public static JTextArea createATextArea(int xPos, int yPos, SpringLayout layout, JFrame frame, int width, int height)
      This method takes the parameters given within the method call to generate a JTextArea. component and locate it using a SpringLayout. The text area will be given a size and location, before being returned to the caller in working fashion.
      Parameters:
      xPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the X-axis of the form.
      yPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the Y-axis of the form.
      layout - the SpringLayout component used for positioning the text area.
      frame - the JFrame the text area is being added to.
      width - the width in pixels of the text area.
      height - the height in pixels of the text area.
      Returns:
      the completed text area is returned to the caller once configured.

    • createAScrollBar

      public static JScrollPane createAScrollBar(int xPos, int yPos, int width, int height, JFrame frame, SpringLayout layout, JTextArea myTextAreaWithScrollbar)
      This method takes the parameters given within the method call to generate a scroll pane component and locate it using a SpringLayout. The scroll pane will be given a location and dimension on the screen. The scroll pane is fit in a text area.
      Parameters:
      xPos - distance in pixels from the top left corner along the X-axis of the form.
      yPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the Y-axis of the form.
      width - the width in pixels of the scroll pane.
      height - height the height in pixels of the scroll pane.
      frame - the JFrame the scroll pane is being added to.
      layout - the SpringLayout component used for positioning the scroll pane.
      myTextAreaWithScrollbar - the JTextArea the scroll pane is being added to.
      Returns:
      the completed scroll pane is returned to the caller once configured.

    • createALabel

      public static JLabel createALabel(String text, int xPos, int yPos, int width, int height, SpringLayout layout, JFrame frame)
      This method takes the parameters given within the method call to generate a JLabel with background color component and locate it using a SpringLayout. The label will be given text to display and a location on screen, before being returned to the caller in working fashion. The size of the label will be set to whatever size is needed to display the given text in the current font setting.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to be printed on the label
      xPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the X-axis of the form
      yPos - the distance in pixels from the top left corner along the Y-axis of the form
      width - the width in pixels of the label.
      height - the height in pixels of the label.
      layout - the SpringLayout component used for positioning label
      frame - the JFrame the label is being added to.
      Returns:
      the completed label with background color is returned to the caller once configured.
